availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Civil Appointments, 1859-1862

body.p:
State of Kentucky. Madison County, Sct:
April County Court 1862.

It is ordered to be certified to the Governor of this Commonwealth, that satisfactory proof was this day made to the Court, that Irvine A. Hunter, Justice of the Peace for Madison County, in District No 5, has removed from the District, and thereby vacated his office.

A Copy attest Tho. H. Barnes, Clerk
Madison County Court

State of Kentucky Madison County, Sct.
April County Court 1862.

It is ordered to be certified to the Governor of this Commonwealth, that satisfactory proof was this day made to the Court, that Cyrus B Cook, a Justice of the Peace for Madison County, in District No 6, has removed from the District and thereby vacated his office

A Copy,
Attest Tho. H. Barnes, Clerk
Madison County Court

Madison Co.
J. P. Dist
No 5. & 6
Issd July 28 1862
